subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Brian Chesky: Airbnb Born From Desperation
description: A quick win: understand Brian Chesky: Airbnb Born From Desperation.

hook.text: Brian Chesky couldn't afford rent. So he rented air mattresses in his living room to strangers.

buildup.text: He and Joe Gebbia bought cereal boxes and sold 'Obama O's' at the 2008 DNC to fund the startup.

discovery.text: Investors rejected Airbnb 7 times. 'Strangers sleeping in your home? Nobody wants that.'

twist.text: Y Combinator accepted themâ€”not because of the idea, but because the founders refused to die.

climax.text: Airbnb is now worth over $80 billion. More rooms than any hotel chain, without owning a single one.

punchline.text: The craziest ideas win when the founders are crazy enough to persist.

quiz.question: Why did Y Combinator accept Airbnb despite a 'crazy' idea?
options: The founders' relentless persistence and refusal to give up impressed them
The founders had impressive technical backgrounds
The idea had already gained significant traction
